p.s: Avocado is one of the beautiful fruits typically grown in summer .
High in both flavor and vitamins , this fruit is also surprisingly easy to grow and nurture .
It makes a simple , satisfying project for people of all ages .
Though avocados may take a long time to bear fruit , something about homegrown avocados make it worth the wait !
Read this article to learn how to grow an avocado ; from pit to fruit .
This fruit is delicious but also healthy with lots of vitamins .

item.s: Take an avocado and cut it in half .
Be careful not to damage the pit ( also known as an avocado seed ) .
Use a knife and make a small cut in the avocado skin .

figure.rend: Cut an Avocado Without Touching the Flesh Step 2.jpg

item.s: Twist both sides of the fruit to release the seed .
Use a knife as needed to take out the pit .

figure.rend: Grow an Avocado As a Houseplant Step 3.jpg

item.s: Rinse the avocado pit ; make sure you do n't damage it .
The seed is the most crucial part of the process !

figure.rend: Grow an Avocado As a Houseplant Step 4.jpg

item.s: Stick the 3 toothpicks in the avocado :
careful not to poke it in the line in the center of the pit .
Stick it in at approximately a 45-degree angle .

figure.rend: Grow an Avocado As a Houseplant Step 9.jpg

item.s: Take a plastic cup and fill it up with water .
Place the avocado pit in the water .
Soak at least half of the avocado pit .
Next just put it in a warm , sunny spot ( out of direct sunlight ) on a windowsill , and let it sit there .
Be patient ; avocados take a long time to grow .

figure.rend: Grow an Avocado As a Houseplant Step 11.jpg

item.s: Change the water on a daily basis .
Remove it out of the old water and switch it out with new water .
Make sure to wipe the avocado pit down ; as the old water can cause the seed to rot over time .

figure.rend: Grow an Avocado As a Houseplant Step 12.jpg

item.s: Allow the seed to sit in the cup when your seed starts sprouting and growing roots .
Once the leaves start yellowing and curling up , it is a sign that it needs to be put in the soil .

figure.rend: Grow an Avocado As a Houseplant Step 13.jpg

item.s: When you plant the avocado pit in soil , do n't put in the whole seed .
The avocado will not grow completely if done so .
Put half of the seed under soil and half of the seed above the dirt .
Make sure to water the avocado regularly ; avocados require a lot of water to bear fruit .

figure.rend: Grow an Avocado As a Houseplant Step 17.jpg

item.s: If possible , plant the avocado near fully grown trees ; this will aid with pollination .
You can also leave the seed outside for a week before you soak it in water .
That makes it easier to peel the skin off .
Plant the seed outside in an undisturbed spot .
Make sure it has lots of sunlight .
When your avocado tree gets larger , you may consider trimming it .
The avocado needs time to grow .
It will not sprout as fast as you think it will .
